bug.author: Roulbac
bug.summary: PyTorch expand receiving 3 inputs while expecting 2
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêûDescribe the bug</denchmark-h>
Error converting the expand operation from pytorch to coreML <denchmark-h:h2>Trace</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>ValueError: node 7 (expand) got 3 input(s), expected 2 </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
If a python script can reproduce the error, please paste the code snippet
<denchmark-code>import torch import coremltools as ct
class ExpandModel(torch.nn.Module): def forward(self, x): return x.expand(3, 3, 608, 608)
x = torch.randn(1, 3, 608, 608) model = ExpandModel()
traced = torch.jit.trace(model, x)
ml_model = ct.convert(model, inputs=[ct.TensorType("foo", shape=x.shape)])
</denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>System environment (please complete the following information):</denchmark-h>
coremltools version : 4.0b2 OS (e.g., MacOS, Linux): Ubuntu 18 How you install python (anaconda, virtualenv, system): conda python version (e.g. 3.7): 3.6.10

comments.comment: Thanks <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Roulbac>@Roulbac</denchmark-link> for reporting the issue. We are looking into it.
i am also getting same error ValueError: node 636 (expand) got 3 input(s), expected 2 any luck on the fix ?
Thanks for reporting this issue, this has been fixed in the coremltools==4.0b4 release. Feel free to re-open or create another issue if you're still experiencing issues. Thanks!
